name: Actionable Notification
info: [Documentation](https://zachowj.github.io/node-red-contrib-home-assistant-websocket/cookbook/actionable-notifications-subflow-for-android.html)

name: create service call
build message
create clear notification
Notify
data: {	   "title":"📈 Room Resized",	   "message":room_friendly &" area increase from "&area&"m² to "&new_area&"m²",	   "data":{	       "tty":0,	       "priority":"high"	       }	}

rules.to: room_friendly &" area measured "&new_area&"m² instead of "&    area&"m²."

name: Calculate Debris
Calculate Debris
Choose Fan Intensity and Begin Cleaning
Fan Speed 2
info: The roborock accepts the fan speed name, so that is passed to the next node. We save the fan speed as a number to determine the modifier when the vacuum finishes.

name: Fan Speed 1
info: The roborock accepts the fan speed name, so that is passed to the next node. We save the fan speed as a number to determine the modifier when the vacuum finishes.

name: Fan Speed 0
info: The roborock accepts the fan speed name, so that is passed to the next node. We save the fan speed as a number to determine the modifier when the vacuum finishes.

name: Home?
info: Maximum fan speed if no one is home

name: Night?
info: Minimum fan speed if it is night. Medium fan speed otherwise

name: Segment Set?
info: In the rare situation that no segment was called, the vacuum will clean the entire floor. Ideally this should never occur, but there are use cases where it might be necessary, and it is a good backup plan.
This flow sets the fan speed and checks that the segment is valid before calling the vacuum. It uses the input_boolean.location_home and input_boolean.location_night to determine the fan speed.

name: Vacuum Returning
info: When the vacuum is returning, we want to log all the data and send it to the next room.

name: Calculate Debris
Pull variables
Calculate
Highest debris
info: Pull the highest debris value for the area this vacuum can clean. We can reverse engineer this information to determine which room segment it is.

name: Any Room
info: Find the room that matches the highest debris.

name: Request Queue?
info: If the current vacuum was triggered by the queue counter, use the upper path. The upper path allows rooms with less than 1.0 debris to be valid cleaning targets.

name: Dirty Rooms
info: Find the room that matches the highest debris, but only if it is above 1.0. If it is less than 1.0 the payload is blocked and the vacuum will not run.

name: Room Segments

info:
This section determines which room to vacuum. If it is a request queue, it takes the upper path that does not have a minimum debris requirement. 

You'll need to add your rooms to the room segment function. They should be formatted as they are in the debris entities; all lower case and with underscores instead of spaces such as "living_room" or "dining room".  Mine are grouped by vacuum.

name: Queued Empty?
info: If there are any room clean requests in the vacuum's queue, bypass the normal flow to trigger the vacuum immediately.

name: Cleaning Queue
info:
Triggers the vacuum to immediately clean the currently dirtiest room, even if it is not above 1.00 debris level. 

Multiple queues will cause the vacuum to clean multiple rooms.

We only want this to trigger a cleaning while the vacuum isn't busy. If there are already items in the queue, the vacuum is busy.

name: Determine vacuum

info: Check all vacuums every 5 minutes. If a room needs cleaning and the area is available for cleaning, do it!

name: Home?
info: If this is a location-away trigger, go ahead and clean. Otherwise, check each vacuum for valid cleaning rules

name: Returning
info: Vacuum should check if it needs to clean another room.

name: Read Me!
info:
Triggers the vacuum cleaning.

The inject causes the vacuum to check if it needs to run every 5 minutes. The vacuum also automatically checks when it is returning to the dock. These two checks go through the restrictions you set up, such as an area being inactive for a time or everyone being in bed. 

For my routines, I want all of the vacuums to clean if necessary when I leave. I have an input_boolean for tracking if we are home or not. It is set to off when everyone leaves, and this bypasses the normal checks and has the vacuums clean all the rooms that need it.

Cleaning queue also bypasses checks. Later in the flow it uses a less restricted method to determine which room to clean.



### Please check the comments on the function nodes to see if you need to edit them for your devices ###

name: Location Away
info: Bypasses the parameter check to start the vacuum when everyone leaves the house.

name: Home?
info: Prevents the inject from checking room states while the house is empty. This is to prevent pet accidents from being spread by the vacuums.

name: Edit this switch
info: This switch points to each vacuum's parameters for cleaning. Your parameters will be different from mine, so you will have to connect a link-in node to each link-out and adjust the switch to your vacuum names.

name: Cleaning?
info: Decreasing the cleaning queue causes a new flow to trigger.
Gives the vacuum a chance to report its cleaning state so it can potentially ignore changes if it is already cleaning or errored.
